channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trolley flytipped in alleyway between 24-26 Thanet Road, 25th February
item.description:
Trolley flytipped in alleyway between 24-26 Thanet Road - it is full up with loads of food and resident saw a young man walk it down the road, dump it in the alleyway and run off...she tried calling after him but no response. Please can this be removed asap as been there few days now and they don't want it attracting rodents etc...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public bin request for Woolwich road/ west heath road, 25th February
item.description:

item.title: Cannibas smell Edwy House, 25th February
item.description:
Persistent cannabis smell in the area that has been ongoing for several weeks. The odor is constant and particularly strong during the evening and nighttime hours. Unfortunately, it has begun to significantly affect my sleep and overall comfort in my home.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in off street parking, 25th February
item.description:
Hello, I hope this finds you well. Individuals have dumped building rubble in our off street parking. We had a small amount of gravel that we ordered for gardening purposes and somone has subsequently dumped bags and what seems to be tar on top.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burma Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road markings in Magpie Hall Lane have faded so badly, they are a danger to road users. They all fail reflectivity regulations and potentially leave LBB open to prosecution in the event of an accident. This also applies to numerus road markings throughout the borough., 25th February
item.description:
See above
